member.name: M:Mandrill.IMandrillApi.DeleteSubaccount(Mandrill.Requests.SubAccounts.DeleteSubAccountRequest)
member.summary: Delete an existing subaccount. Any email related to the subaccount will be saved, but stats will be removed and any future sending calls to this subaccount will fail. Mandrill API Documentation
member.returns: the information for the deleted subaccount

member.name: M:Mandrill.IMandrillApi.ListSubaccounts(Mandrill.Requests.SubAccounts.ListSubAccountsRequest)
member.summary: Get the list of subaccounts defined for the account, optionally filtered by a prefix. Mandrill API Documentation
member.returns: the subaccounts for the account, up to a maximum of 1,000

member.name: M:Mandrill.IMandrillApi.PauseSubaccount(Mandrill.Requests.SubAccounts.PauseSubAccountRequest)
member.summary: Pause a subaccount's sending. Any future emails delivered to this subaccount will be queued for a maximum of 3 days until the subaccount is resumed. Mandrill API Documentation
member.returns: the information for the paused subaccount

member.name: M:Mandrill.IMandrillApi.ResumeSubaccount(Mandrill.Requests.SubAccounts.ResumeSubAccountRequest)
member.summary: Resume a paused subaccount's sending Mandrill API Documentation
member.returns: the information for the resumed subaccount

member.name: M:Mandrill.IMandrillApi.SubaccountInfo(Mandrill.Requests.SubAccounts.SubAccountInfoRequest)

member.summary: Get the information for a single recently sent message.

member.name: M:Mandrill.MandrillApi.Search(Mandrill.Requests.Messages.SearchRequest)
member.summary: Search recently sent messages and optionally narrow by date range, tags, senders, and API keys. If no date range is specified, results within the last 7 days are returned. This method may be called up to 20 times per minute. If you need the data more often, you can use /messages/info.json to get the information for a single message, or webhooks to push activity to your own application for querying. Mandrill API Documentation

member.name: M:Mandrill.Requests.Messages.SendMessageTemplateRequest.#ctor(Mandrill.Models.EmailMessage,System.String)
member.param: The other information on the message to send - same as /messages/send, but without the html content.
The immutable name or slug of a template that exists in the user's account. For backwards-compatibility, the template name may also be used but the immutable slug is preferred.

member.param: The other information on the message to send - same as /messages/send, but without the html content.
The immutable name or slug of a template that exists in the user's account. For backwards-compatibility, the template name may also be used but the immutable slug is preferred.
An array of template content to send.

member.summary: The other information on the message to send - same as /messages/send, but without the html content.

P:Mandrill.Requests.Messages.SendMessageTemplateRequest.IpPool
member.summary: The name of the dedicated ip pool that should be used to send the message. If you do not have any dedicated IPs, this parameter has no effect. If you specify a pool that does not exist, your default pool will be used instead.

member.name: P:Mandrill.Requests.Messages.SendMessageTemplateRequest.SendAt
member.summary: When this message should be sent as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If you specify a time in the past, the message will be sent immediately. An additional fee applies for scheduled email, and this feature is only available to accounts with a positive balance.
